intro: Banisteria atrosanguinea var. benthamiana, commonly known as the black blood vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round fruits. Its unique appearance and medicinal properties have made it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ethnobotanical research.
